title: How to Make Giant Bubble Mix

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
You'll need:
4 cups of water
2 cups of liquid dish soap
2 cups of glycerin
2 teaspoons of corn syrup.

steps.headline: Pour all of the ingredients into a shallow pan.
Stir mixture slowly until they are all mixed together.
Bend hanger into whatever shape you want.
steps.description: You can even use an already formed bubble wand(just make sure there aren't any openings).

steps.headline: Dip the hanger into the bubble mixture, and lift out carefully.
Blow or wave the hanger/wand to make the bubbles.
steps.description: You can also hold out the wand and run with it to make the bubbles fly behind you!

steps.headline: When you are finished with the mixture and you still have some left, pour into an airtight container.
Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
You'll need:
11 cups warm water
1 cup clear Dawn detergent
1 cup corn syrup
1/2 cup glycerin.

steps.headline: Place all of the ingredients into a bucket.
steps.description: Mix together very slowly and mix only lightly.

steps.headline: Pour into a large container with a lid.
steps.description: Do not shake while pouring. A milk jug makes an ideal container.

steps.headline: Cover and wait at least 24 hours.
steps.description: It will stay good for ages if kept tightly covered.

steps.headline: Use.
steps.description: Bend a coat hanger or wire into a bubble stick shape, or use a regular large bubble stick blower. Enjoy blowing absolutely enormous bubbles!

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
You'll need:
10 parts water
2 parts liquid dish washing detergent
2 parts cough syrup (main ingredients are glycerine & sucrose); if you use a flavor you like it will also smell nice and can add a neat color too.

steps.headline: Mix the ingredients together in a large container with a lid.
Let it sit for a bit to combine and settle.
Pour some into a shallow dish.
steps.description: Dip the bubble wand in. Blow your fun and large bubbles.

text:
Plain dish soap bubble mix Gather the ingredients. You'll need:
4 cups of water
2 cups of liquid dish soap
2 cups of glycerin
2 teaspoons of corn syrup. Pour all of the ingredients into a shallow pan.  Stir mixture slowly until they are all mixed together.  Bend hanger into whatever shape you want. You can even use an already formed bubble wand(just make sure there aren't any openings). Dip the hanger into the bubble mixture, and lift out carefully.  Blow or wave the hanger/wand to make the bubbles. You can also hold out the wand and run with it to make the bubbles fly behind you! When you are finished with the mixture and you still have some left, pour into an airtight container.  Dawn detergent bubble mix Gather the ingredients. You'll need:
11 cups warm water
1 cup clear Dawn detergent
1 cup corn syrup
1/2 cup glycerin. Place all of the ingredients into a bucket. Mix together very slowly and mix only lightly. Pour into a large container with a lid. Do not shake while pouring. A milk jug makes an ideal container. Cover and wait at least 24 hours. It will stay good for ages if kept tightly covered. Use. Bend a coat hanger or wire into a bubble stick shape, or use a regular large bubble stick blower. Enjoy blowing absolutely enormous bubbles! Cough syrup bubble mix Gather the ingredients. You'll need:
10 parts water
2 parts liquid dish washing detergent
2 parts cough syrup (main ingredients are glycerine & sucrose); if you use a flavor you like it will also smell nice and can add a neat color too. Mix the ingredients together in a large container with a lid.  Shake together well.  Let it sit for a bit to combine and settle.  Pour some into a shallow dish. Dip the bubble wand in. Blow your fun and large bubbles.
